attributes.action: Refund for London TFL strikes to the commuters as they couldn’t use the service
attributes.additional_details: This has caused inconvenince for all the commuters as the tube is not working, buses are full, traffic jams are increasing affecting loads of businesses and personal lives of Londoners and people who travel to London.
attributes.background: The Government and Parliament needs to stop the strikes as soon as possible or held a meeting with who ever is organising the strike.They should also refund the money for commuters who has paid upfront for the annual, monthly or weekly passes

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. Matters relating to Transport for London is the responsibility of the London Assembly and the Mayor of London.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here:

https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions
